name: The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore

reviews.text: I read the reviews and my expectation is pretty high for a supposedly 6 star hotel. I arrived at 2am and expected topnotch services. Instead I was greeted with a stone face lady at the front desk who used the right choice of words in her greeting without any warmth.
reviews.title: Front desk service is appalling

likes.liked: — The bathtub besides the window - only at night
likes.disliked: — Front Desk Service - Checked in received stone faced front desk and checked out waited 10 minutes for front desk to end her phone conversation.

reviews.text: For 6 days I stayed in this hotel, I was observing the front desk staffs while waiting for my colleague. I noticed most of them do not smile except I guy. The front desk manager is worst. While I was complaining to her, occasionally, her eyes were directed at the front desk and smiled. Her choice of words used example “I’m from your country and I will not lie to you.” This is truly an unprofessional remark. Except for the front desk, the services from the doorman to the guest relation staffs are impeccable.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Poor Staff

reviews.text: I truly agreed with one of the reviewer from the room, the nightlight of the Singapore skyline is breathtaking. I was shocked by daylight the view is spoilt by cranes and construction. Experienced the same thing. I switched room from 6th floor to 10th floor and realized the previous room is cleaner and the towels/bathrobe were of better quality. Those on 10th floor were hard and I had to clean the stain on the milk jug.
reviews.title: Better than the reviews

reviews.text: I was there for a meeting with several colleagues from other countries. We stayed at different hotels. I’m returning to Singapore in April for 10 days and has made reservation in the same hotel. Waiting for my colleagues review on hotels they stayed and if it's better, I will switch with no second thoughts.
reviews.title: A bit of city Luxury and what a view

likes.disliked: — Had to ask for fresh milk and earl grey tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really looking forward to staying at this hotel on a stopover on the way back from Europe. I arrived there at about 11am and the check-in staff tell me that they only had smoking or single bedded rooms available for me. i was so tired from a long flight the last thing i needed is to be messed around at check-in. I asked how long i would have to wait until the room i book became free and was told i that it was only a request and they don't guarantee room types, but for a king room i would have to wait until 1pm. Then i was offered an upgrade for $100.00, when i agreed she then said that i would have to wait 1 hour for that (what a joke). I said forget it and went for a walk around Singapore for a few hours. when i returned they had a room ready for me and said they had upgraded me for free. The room was great very large with a lounge room, bedroom, very large bathroom with walk in robe and toilet, it had two plasma TV's and a bose cd player. I ordered room service and apart from it being quite expensive the food was really nice. The room had great views out over Singapore harbor and the bathroom has a view out over the Singapore big wheel (London eye thing). The other thing is there is no free internet at this hotel, even in the hotel lobby you have to pay and its not cheep at all, the joke was that from my room i could get the signal from Singapore's free internet service that they have around town.
reviews.title: Most excellent hotel - ever

likes.liked: — Everyting. Super friendly staff and extreme luxury. Eye for details.
likes.disliked: — Internet and breakfast were not complementary, even for long stay and full rates.

reviews.text: I go to Singapore approx 4 times a year for business and used to stay at the Ritz-Carlton regularly (I now stay at the Conrad).
reviews.title: Nice hotel but rooms need a facelift

reviews.text: The Ritz-Carlton is a nice hotel with nice facilities; however, the rooms definitely need a facelift. The rooms are very spacious but the furniture (and wallpaper!) need to be upgraded. It's not that they are horrible but just not the thing you expect from a 5-star hotel. Also, in this day and age of plasma and LCD TVs, the Ritz-Carlton still have those chunky TVs in their rooms. On a couple of occasions they've had to send engineers in to fix the TV in my room - maybe they should upgrade these too?
reviews.title: Nice, overrated and smelly

likes.liked: — View of marina from room, lovely door/concierge staff

reviews.text: I love the restaurants at the Ritz-Carlton and the service is usually good although sometimes over the top. I am not a morning person and everyday as I walk through the lobby on my way to work at least 10 hotel people greet me. Occasionally there will be a sleazy male hotel employee who will openly stare and leer at me and other female visitors. Just not something you want to deal iwth on your way to work each morning.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Anyway, as I mentioned, I used to stay at this hotel but have since started staying at the Conrad.
reviews.title: Despite criticism on tripadvisor - hotel was fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Singapore for 3 nights in February 2008 to see my Brother and Family who live there now. Lacking availability at the Shangri La we stayed in The Ritz Carlton. It's a lovely hotel but I feel that it is more suitable for corporate/business travelers than visitors.
reviews.title: The most comfortable beds ever, for a good nights sleep stay here!

likes.liked: — The bed the bath, where do i start.... everything!
likes.disliked: — Just a little too far out from the main shopping street.

reviews.title: Business Hotel - not bad but could do with a lick of paint
reviews.text: 'Fabulous location with spectacular views' - all too true but would say that whilst the room was spacious and had been recently updated, the large bathroom was a little antiquated and could have done with renovation - that said, towels had a fluffy home feel and fresh orchids brightened the room. The staff were friendly and helpful but couldn't quite shake the feeling that there three staff to every one guest - seemed to be a lot of staff loitering around corridors and lifts which frankly seemed odd compared to other hotels in the immediate vicinity such as the Fullerton. The breakfast buffet was expansive and tasty and would definitely recommend this hotel as a business hotel but it's all too mechanical for a holiday hotel. I didn't use the spa but the gym was well equipped and comfortable. All in all 3/4 out of 5.

reviews.title: Excellent stays
reviews.text: Ritz Carlton in Singapore is an excellent hotel, located off Marina Bay, a sea side area with lots of nice restaurants and clubs.

reviews.title: Nice View
reviews.text: Overall, the staff is overly polite, and helpful.

reviews.title: Best View in Singapore!
reviews.text: The standard rooms are more like one bedroom apartments, with separate bath, shower, wardrobe, and full comfort facilities, including LCD TV and DVD.

reviews.title: Impeccable Service
reviews.text: The hotel;s restaurants are excellent also.

As usual, we are never disappointed by the RC Carlton service. The ambience, the staff, the service, everything is provided with diligent, flawless and attentive service. Amenities were superb, the LCD TV, the DVD player. The view is also lovely. The landscape is great.
reviews.title: Overall a good Ritz Carlton but not as good as the RC Tokyo or RC Osaka

likes.liked: — Friendly and attentive staff. Club lounge and the food and beverage presentations
likes.disliked: — Problems over the cigatette odour in the room

reviews.text: We arrived at Singapore Airport from London and a private car (provided by the hotel) was waiting for myself and my partner. Our bags were taken off us and we were escorted to the car (we never saw our luggage until we arrived in our room)
reviews.title: Life of the rich and famous

reviews.text: The weather is very humid, together after a long flight from London and the tiredness it was nice to receive a friendly smile from the driver.
reviews.title: Terrible room, Cheap breakfast

likes.disliked: — rooms, docor, Breakfast is the worst

reviews.text: Located in front of the passenger’s seats were 2 cold towels and 2 bottles of perfectly chilled mineral water which was nice and refreshing after the long flight.
reviews.title: Not deserving of Ritz Carlton title

likes.liked: — Bathoom with a great view from the bath!

reviews.text: The journey to the RC hotel was comfortable. It seemed that the journey took no time at all, maybe we fell asleep!
reviews.title: Something special

description: Minutes away from some of Singpaore's most iconic attractions including the Marina Bay and Singapore Flyer, this newly-renovated luxury hotel provides privileged access to one of the world's most vibrant cities. While the panoramic glittering views of the city skyline and Marina Bay invites exploration, the centrally-located hotel has some outstanding reasons for guests to stay in, ranging from the stellar collection of 4,200 contemporary art pieces including works by Frank Stella, Dale Chihuly and Andy Warhol, as well as the lush idyllic pool perfect for enjoying the tropical warmth at. Guests enjoy a multitude of shopping, dining and entertainment options at three shopping malls accessible via covered skybridge as well as public transportation options within walking distance.
